sourceMeaningMnemonic: Behind that <radical>tree</radical> the <radical>sun</radical> is rising in the <kanji>east</kanji>. The sun always rises in the east, so if you head that way, past the tree, you'll be going east too.
meaningInfo: Picture the sun behind the tree, don't picture the sun alone, you'll burn your eyes. It's slowly coming up behind it. Now think: where does the sun rise? In the east!
readingMnemonic: You walk <kanji>east</kanji> for a few hours until you finally come to a city. It's <ja><reading>とう</reading>きょう</ja>. Oh! <ja>とうきょう</ja> is in the east. I get it now!
readingInfo: When you think about East Japan think about <ja>とうきょう</ja>. And if you're bad at geography, just look at a map for a while. Or, stand outside in the morning, watch the sun rise behind the trees, and point that way. That's east, it's where <ja>とうきょう</ja> is!
